comments.text:
The reason he is not in jail is that the USA is not a democracy. In a 
democracy, if you are accused of a crime, and there is evidence that you 
did it, you stand trial based on that proof. No matter who you are, or how 
high in the power structure you are, that's what happens. It's a basic law 
of democratic government. Sadly, though, the USA is a corporatist oligarchy 
that PRETENDS to be a democracy, and in a CO, if you're in the elite, 
you're above the law. Watergate was the prototype.

Why would the UR go down? Under BO, the EPA makes sure you can't exploit

comments.text:
Thank you for another ad homenin attack Kelly. That indicates the strength 
of an argument generally. Unemployment was 7.8% when BO came in. 4 years 
later it is 7.9%. The labor participation rate is at a 30 year low. So many 
people have dropped out of the work force, 7.9% is a fraudulent figure; 
lower denominator, the better the number. If people started joining the 
work force again, the number would not improve for a long time. Disability, 
food stamps, welfare, all up dramatically under BO.
comments.author: Ashley Tinzel

comments.text:
It's this kind of thing that gives Anarchy a bad name. Your side is the

comments.author: 54markl

comments.text:
When the Democrats lost with McGovern and Mondale, everyone was predicting 
their eminent demise. What had just happened was that the Solid South had 
just turned Republican, and the North did not yet realize that they had to 
turn Democratic to offset this. But the Democrats wisely moved more to the 
center (though not entirely), and today they are thriving. It remains to be 
seen if the Republicans can duplicate this feat. I personally think they 
cannot, they are too rigid and hate all change.
comments.author: 54markl
